==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|十|六|夜}}

===Etymology===
Read as いさよい (''isayoi'') in the [[w:Nara Period|Nara Period]], alternating with いざよい (''izayoi'') in the [[w:Heian Period|Heian Period]], and settling on いざよい (''izayoi'') thereafter.

From the conjunctive or gerund form ({{l|ja|連用形|tr=''ren'yōkei''}}) of the verb {{l|ja|猶予う|tr=''izayou''}}, meaning {{m|en|pause|to pause}}, {{m|en|hesitate|to hesitate}}.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いざよい|hhira=いざよひ}}

# Short for {{lang|ja|十六夜の}}{{l|ja|月}} (''izayoi no tsuki''): the [[moon]] just past [[full moon]], the start of the [[waning]] moon.
# The [[sixteenth]] of the [[month]] under the [[lunar calendar]], the night just after [[full moon]]; compare to English {{m|en|ides}}. A common time for viewing the [[harvest moon]] in the Japanese {{l|ja|月見|tr=''[[tsukimi]]''}} [[festival]].
# Being [[sixteen]] years old.
# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=いざよい}} A [[bet]] of 16 {{l|ja|銭|tr=''sen''}} on a [[competition]] or [[game of chance]].
# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=いざよい}}.

====Derived terms====
* {{lang|ja|十六夜の}}{{l|ja|月}} (''izayoi no tsuki''): The [[moon]] just past [[full moon]], the start of the [[waning]] moon. Also known as {{l|ja|既望}}{{lang|ja|の}}{{l|ja|月}} (''kibō no tsuki'').
* {{l|ja|十六夜清心|tr=''Izayoi Seishin''}}: Common name for the [[Kabuki]] play, {{lang|ja|小袖曾我薊色縫}} (こそでそがあざみのいろぬい, ''Kosode Soga Azami no Ironui''). (See [[Wikipedia:ja:小袖曾我薊色縫]].)
* {{l|ja|十六夜日記|tr=''Izayoi Nikki''}}: A single-volume [[travelogue]] written in the mid-[[w:Kamakura Period|Kamakura Period]] by the Buddhist nun Abutsu-ni. (See [[Wikipedia:ja:十六夜日記]], [[Wikipedia:ja:阿仏尼]].)
* {{lang|ja|十六夜}}{{l|ja|日記}}{{l|ja|残月}}{{l|ja|鈔}} (''Izayoi Nikki Zangetsu Shō''): The first [[annotation]] of the ''Izayoi Nikki''. Comprised of three volumes, jointly written by late-[[w:Edo Period|Edo Period]] literary scholar 小山田与清 (Oyamada Tomoyuki) and his [[apprentice]] 北条時隣 (Hōjō Tokichika) and published in 1824. (See [[Wikipedia:ja:十六夜日記残月鈔]].)
* {{l|ja|十六夜薔薇|tr=''izayoi bara''}}: The [[chestnut]] or [[burr]] [[rose]]: a species of rose native to east Asia, {{taxlink|Rosa roxburghii|species|noshow=1}}. Member of sub-genus {{m|en|Platyrhodon}}.
